TITLE.P: Technical Evaluation for Low Carbon Heating and District Heating Networks

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Supplier appointed to this Framework Agreement will be capable of providing advice and support on a Call Off basis for the assessment of the technical, economic and environmental feasibility of low carbon technologies and district heat networks and systems.

The Framework covers a range of potential support requirements, including all aspects of technical, economic and environmental advice and support that may be required by Zero Waste Scotland and/or our Clients for the development of low carbon and district heat network options and opportunities. It includes the ability to provide subject experts to lead on, support or provide training to key staff within Client organisations for the development of pre-feasibility/feasibility studies, business cases, impact assessments, environmental action plans or similar, including analysis and appraisal of options and calculation of environmental and/or economic benefits.

MAIN_SITE.P: Place of performance to be identified and agreed at time of Call Off.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Supplier appointed to this Framework Agreement will have a firm understanding of the subject matter and policy environment, along with relevant technical, environmental and economic skills and expertise to be capable of providing analysis and support on a Call Off basis for the assessment of the technical, economic and environmental feasibility of low carbon technologies heat systems and district heating networks.

The Framework covers a range of potential support requirements, including all aspects of technical, economic and environmental analysis and support that may be required by Zero Waste Scotland and/or our Clients for the development of low carbon heat projects and district heating network opportunities. It includes the ability to provide subject experts to lead on, support or provide training to key staff within Client organisations for the development of pre-feasibility/feasibility studies, including analysis and appraisal of options and calculation of project benefits.
Where the analysis includes a heat network, successful bidders will be required to conduct a feasibility to CIBSE CP1: Heat Networks: Code of Practice for the UK (2015) standards.
Further details are provided in the Tender document.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Single 12-month extension period available, subject to continued business need and funding.

INFO_ADD.P: The Framework Agreement will conclude no later than 24 months from the date of commencement, unless we are required to discontinue the provision in accordance with Clause 16.2.12 of Section 4 (Terms and Conditions of Contract).
The quality submission will be scored using the Scottish Government's recommended scoring convention, reproduced below:

1. Excellent: response is completely relevant and excellent overall. The response is comprehensive, unambiguous and demonstrates a thorough understanding of the requirement and provides details of how the requirement will be met in full;
2. Good: response is relevant and good. The response is sufficiently detailed to demonstrate a good understanding and provides details on how the requirements will be fulfilled;
3. Acceptable: response is relevant and acceptable. The response addresses a broad understanding of the requirement but may lack details on how the requirement will be fulfilled in certain areas;

4. Poor: response is partially relevant but generally poor. The response addresses some elements of the requirement but contains insufficient/limited detail or explanation to demonstrate how the requirement will be fulfilled;
5. Unacceptable: Nil or inadequate response. Fails to demonstrate an ability to meet the requirement.
